This holiday season, I’m thankful for California. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DRrauXUVoAAG1rr.jpg
Last night, I voted no on the stopgap government spending bill because I can't justify leaving for the holidays while hundreds of thousands of Dreamers live in uncertainty and fear.
Yesterday I voted against the short-term and short-sighted spending bill that neglected Dreamers and refused to provide a long-term solution to fund CHIP.

It's moments like these that we have to look in the mirror and ask, who are we as a country? Are we the kind of country that has a government program that intentionally targets families, and separates children from their parents? https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/to-curb-illegal-border-crossings-trump-administration-weighs-new-measures-targeting-families/2017/12/21/19300dc2-e66c-11e7-9ec2-518810e7d44d_story.html?utm_term=.67ea20592199

Without question, Russia interfered in the 2016 election. We must act immediately to defend the next election from foreign attacks. Yesterday, I introduced the Secure Elections Act. https://gizmodo.com/senators-introduce-bipartisan-bill-to-secure-election-s-1821501882

In response to Russia interfering with the 2016 election, I introduced the Secure Elections Act, which will help fortify our election systems against attacks by foreign powers.

RT @guypbenson Extraordinary & telling statistic from @jaketapper's important monologue yesterday: Between 2012-2015, the UN General Assembly passed 97 resolutions that singled out one country for condemnation. From Venezuela’s petro-$$ scheme to Russia’s arms sales & intelligence operations – this external influence solidifies the future for the people of Nicaragua & raises national security implications for U.S. & our allies throughout the Western Hemisphere.

It's incumbent on U.S. to address Ortega’s brazen overreach & incentivize meaningful reform. If we allow Nicaragua’s ruling elite to exploit international loans to further embed their corrupt enterprises w anti-American regimes, we're turning a blind eye.
The Ortega regime has gone unchecked for far too long. Hijacking electoral institutions & repressing the opposition has severely undermined democratic order & the will of the people.

Proud to introduce Nicaraguan Investment Conditionality Act w @SenLeahy to hold President Ortega & his regime accountable for its corrupt practices & abuse of human rights by conditioning U.S. approval of international loans to the Government of Nicaragua. https://www.cruz.senate.gov/?p=press_release&id=3567
